Detailed Description

Exposes static methods to initialize and shutdown the entire crypto module.

Member Function Documentation

Boolean  bAllowUnpadded 
)
static

Base64-decode a base64 data buffer.

Parameters
[in]stringInThe input base64 data buffer.
[in]bAllowUnpaddedIf false, the decoder will error if the input length is not a multiple of 4
Returns
The binary output buffer.

String IonicSecurity::SDK::CryptoUtils::binToBase64 ( array< System::Byte >^  byteBufferIn,
Boolean  bAutoNewlines,
int  nMaxLineLength 
)
static

Base64-encode a binary data buffer.

Parameters
[in]byteBufferInThe input binary data buffer.
[in]bAutoNewlinesDetermine if the output should be line-wrapped.
[in]nMaxLineLengthIf bAutoNewLines is true, then this number is the line-wrap threshold in bytes.
Returns
The base64-encoded output buffer.

◆ binToBase64() [3/4]

String IonicSecurity::SDK::CryptoUtils::binToBase64 ( array< System::Byte >^  byteBufferIn,
Boolean  bAutoNewlines,
int  nMaxLineLength,
Boolean  bPad 
)
static

Base64-encode a binary data buffer.

Parameters
[in]byteBufferInThe input binary data buffer.
[in]bAutoNewlinesDetermine if the output should be line-wrapped.
[in]nMaxLineLengthIf bAutoNewLines is true, then this number is the line-wrap threshold in bytes.
[in]bPadFill remaining space with pad character.
Returns
The base64-encoded output buffer.

◆ pbkdf2()

array< System::Byte > IonicSecurity::SDK::CryptoUtils::pbkdf2 ( array< System::Byte >^  byteBufferIn,
array< System::Byte >^  byteBufferSalt,
size_t  nIterations,
size_t  nHashLen 
)
static

Computes a PBKDF2 (SHA-256) hash of the input value optionally including salt value.

Parameters
[in]byteBufferInThe input value to be hashed.
[in]byteBufferSaltThe input salt value to be used in the hash.
[in]nIterationsNumber of PBKDF2 iterations to perform.
[in]nHashLenThe desired length in bytes of the hash to produce.
Returns
The binary output buffer.
